Description: Body sherd of black-figured pottery bowl; glaze mostly fired orange-red; interior: reserved tondo with part of lotus flower bounded by double-dot band; glazed beyond, with perhaps an added red line; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bird (neck, head, and chest missing) to left; incised spoked rosette and dot as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Decorative filling ornament and shape of vessel are not consistent with Clazomenian.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GS.379)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
